conclusion: The refractive index of the semi-cylindrical body is n = 2, the radius is R, and the length is L. Light enters vertically through the rectangular surface and exits through the curved surface.

premise: The height of the part of the cylindrical surface through which light exits is equal to the radius R.
conclusion: The height of the part of the cylindrical surface through which light exits is R.

premise: The area S of the part of the cylindrical surface through which light exits can be calculated using the formula for the area of a rectangle: S = height * length.
